bioghist.p: John Hudson Ballard (1880-1971) was a Presbyterian minister and professor of Pastoral Psychology at San Francisco Theological Seminary. He was a graduate of Union Theological Seminary, and received his Ph.D. from Columbia University in 1915. From 1919 to 1921 he served as Field Director of the PCUSA New Era Movement. He had a long ministerial career, serving in churches in New York, California, and Oregon before being called to the faculty of San Francisco Seminary in 1941. He retired in 1952.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of photographs related to the career of John H. Ballard. Included are portraits of the faculty of Union Theological Seminary in 1914, and group photographs of the leaders of the New Era Movement (1918) and the staff and field representatives of the New Era Movement (1919 or 1920).
